Reviews: I would definitely not recommend this place for employees it used to be a fun place to work but then everything is so micromanaged every thing is knitpicked
The job itself was decent but management needs to be better. I liked most of my coworkers but it felt like a big high school. Din't pay that well at all. Too far to drive.

Manage call floor operations of my team of 13 employees and area of 40 employees.  Just assigned to new department that does not have an official training program in place.  Peers and colleagues very supportive and employees have a can do attitude.  

The most difficult part of the job is learning the area without set operation procedures. 

the best part of the job is working with the people and assisting them in obtaining both personal and business goals.
learned how to do some of the billing for patient medication. working at the this location was okay. it had its perks and it also had downfalls. management was ok
At express script if you get in the  right department things will be good. You do have some area that are not good to work for. I myself go in and do my job to the best of my ability.
Most the answers can be found in their programs and no second guessing. The company provides great support and resources and continually educates all their employees.
they expect more and more out of you everyday but this company pays less than even a bank teller makes. Before Express Scripts bought Accredo the wages were fair. But now they are below average.
Duties include triage of phone calls for PAP/pharmacy, completion of all data entry including use of Microsoft Excel to complete registration rosters.
typical home infusion company , flexible schedule and average pay. must be ok outside the hospital environment as well be able to adapt to different home situations.

Express Scripts is a good starting Pharmacy Job.  Good job to evaluate whether or not you want to be a Pharmacy Tech.   Consistent management and administrative practices.  Due to the process for system sign on, it was common practice for late techs to just clock in on someone else's machine so they were not deemed late while their own machine booted up.    Management often appeared to have nothing to do since they walked around and talked a lot.   Support documents were not kept current which caused a large problem for techs who were blamed for incorrectly entered scripts when the problem was really the fault of the management and support staff.
When you speak, they listen and act. It took a bit , but eventually things got better and they are awesome. My manager is awsome. I just wish we can meet the ceo one day.

Worked here for a year in my position on 2nd shift. Great place to work at for a college kid going to classes in the morning. The warehouse was an easy-going enviorment to work in and everyone really got along.
Express Scripts was a good place to work. Great pharmacy. Always on top of orders and good with customers. They are good to their employees and make sure they know they are appreciated.
working with medicare part d member refilling their medications and assisting with any billing issue and trying to their medication approve by getting prior authorization from dr.office

was not a fit for me, treated people poorly. Management was horrible.
and unfair at Express , from my understanding it has gotten much better now since the Lay offs

This isn't a bad company to work for except that the wage is moderate to low for the Call Center industry and low for the medical billing industry. Being that it is a union shop advancement is not based on skill. Instead it is based solely on tenure, which sees unqualified people leading teams while agents that have the skills to do the job are passed over and then expected to train their supervisors. Once I gave my 2 weeks notice to move to another company Express Scripts fabricated a reason to terminate me so they could cut off my insurance forcing me to delay a scheduled surgery. This is a decent transition job but I would not consider it for a career.

Job culture has its pro's & cons like any other employer. This job culture is elementary oriented. Either you have to be a teachers pet to get ahead, or a target. Management & Leadership has its top picks on who can advance and who won't. Management plots on coworkers based upon other coworkers who dislike you.
The management team does not communicate with employees. Everything is a secret until someone gets wind of it and an employee ask thats when you are told.

Days start busy and stay that way.
It's very challenging and you do learn to maintain yourself in a high stress environment.
The hardest part of the job is keeping up with all that is required.
Days go quickly and you're never bored due to the intensity of the work load.

I am a legacy Medco employee who helped transition accounts once Medco was purchased by Express Scripts Inc. I left due to severance. The culture did change and I'm told pay somewhat decreased; but many changes have been made to grow and improve Express Scripts Inc. I think the market is seeing the benefits of that  now.
Not there for their employees. More about business and customer needs than employees. Known for the call center being “high school” oriented. Not safe.
Express Scripts Inc, ESI is the largest Pharmacy Benefit Manager (PBM) in United States and you will be exposed to a lot of technologies and methods on a daily basis.
The management at esi is horrible they don't care about their employees and supervisors get away with so much. It's like being in jail there no freedom. It's very stressful working there

I have worked at Express Scripts/Medco for the last 15 years. I enjoy working with patients and being a team player. After learning many new positions at my job I would also like to reach out and do more for myself and others.
The manager did not communicate expectations, not clearly explain the job duties.  I was not sure what was expected of me, nor when it was due.  One to one meetings were regularly cancelled.

The only person that was on my side was my floor management. Everyone else is out to get you: Co-workers have to push you down to get ahead, Pharmacists are NOT allowed to help you and have to report you or they get in trouble with you, Upper management only sees you as a number making them money. You can only advance if you ruin the people around you or hope you become a favorite.
Express Scripts Inc, ESI is the largest Pharmacy Benefit Manager (PBM) in United States and you will be exposed to a lot of technologies and methods on a daily basis.

Terrible place to work 
Management is degrading to employees 
No room for advancement 
Little to no pay increase 
Treated unfairly 
Worst place to work on the plant
Given the opportunity, I would love to work for Express Scripts again.  The pay was awesome, I enjoyed my position in resolving escalated issues for members with excellent service,
It was fun working. Directions and procedures to perform work was performed and I really enjoyed being there. Job benefits were really good. However, this company got sold afterwards.
Worked there for 10 years and over the years it has changed I believe the company’s management could be a whole lot better if they replace the management staff.
Overall a good company. I enjoyed making the lives of our customers a little easier. The knowledge you come away with helps if health care is a field your interested in.
Express Scripts is a great job to have if a call center environment is for you. I feel longer training is much needed so that a person is able to feel better prepared for a particular job.
expected to be fast pace, strict rules due to the privacy of our patients. Healthcare Plan knowledge. I enjoyed however the perks of working for this company and the cost was especially decent.
It was okay to work there. No space for professional growth. There was tons of work and I did not feel that all the work I put in plus the time was valued.

Great place to work. I worked from home for 7 years, it was fabulous opportunity. The provided training necessary to get the job done. Managers were available if their assistance was needed. Great people to work with. Developed friends in other states.

After a while, when problems would be found, daily/weekly meetings discussing the same problem from months ago would occur.  Clients were rude and accusatory. We did our best to make them happy, but all of the blame would fall on us, even when the client approved the very thing they were upset about.  Lots of long, stressful hours.  I really would not recommend working here.

Express Scripts is a very challenging environment and allows people to develop under a very difficult and strict work environment.

As a pharmacy, it is good that Express Scripts keeps good controls on performance.  Getting prescriptions right the first time is very serious business.  Therefore, giving opportunities to people is an even more impressive component to the company.

I would recommend early career people to work there for career development.
Manged 3 different areas in my value stream in the daily duties of getting out the medication to out patients. My duties are to get all areas staffed.
Express scripts is a great company, with good hrs & good pay, & Its always room for advancement in the company, you can also learn about other departments
we were able to set our own hours and work from home.  Constant call center rep.  Must have good internet connection to maintain your work schedule.  Enjoyed working from home.
Stressful- Not sure of company stability.   Everyone appears to be nervous and not sure if they will have employment next year. Very talented workforce.  This is unfair o great people
Each supervisor had different standards for the team so if you get with the right supervisor you will succeed. Good pay, nice co-workers, easy to get time off approved with little advanced notice.

This is a stepping stone type of job not for long term. It is great for getting some work experience to put on your resume. You will be on the phones taking care of customers with refills and advising of pricing along with what is covered under their prescription coverage plan.
not recognizing my value and allowing my next phase of growth to happen. i feel i am too embedded in my current area to move to horizontally to other teams and grow vertically there.
Company goal and process changes more often. Currently company is investing in the technology improvement aspects and it is good. Work culture aspect it is good.

I would take any day to be able to return to ESI. I have had the pleasure to help so many people, as well as, learn from. When your are disabled and have the opportunity to help someone else their minds about their medications, PA, etc.. Even though ESI PCA's are middle men and woman, We help those to understand their health benefits and what they can gain from them. I loved my place of work and plan to return. If they hire me back..Thanks ESI for everything..

I am grateful for the knowledge and experiences I obtained from Express Scripts Inc. (ESI).  There is room for advancement.  I made wonderful friends during my time there.  If you come to work and you are serious about learning, you will have a great experience.

It was ideal for me Working from home. The pay was not helping with the cost of living.  I personally loved the job the pay wasn't working for me. I couldn't meet end meets with the pay even with overtime they offered. I don't think they realize the cost of living is rising.

fast paced work with good people offered overtime with great benefits but the policy would change without proper notification. They also didn't care of the situation of what u had going on they just wanted number

The people that worked for the company were great but the corporate and some of the local management was not. We were treated like numbers not people. We had to punch in at a time clock very degrading for a health care professional.  We were subjected to ridiculous production quotas based on the poor quality imaging and computer system. We are dealing with human lives not car parts. A pharmacist was fired for not meeting the quota of 144 prescriptions verified per hour in the physician provider order entry system. This was a unethical act and unobtainable act to have a quota system for prescriptions verified per hour.
Fast paced company where you can learn a lot if in the right department. The hours tend to be off hours, overnights. Managers are in contact with their  employees and available.

Benefits and hours are great, but if you think the company or the managers car about the employees, forget it.  Prepare to be isolated, cover the behinds of shift leads, be just another face, and be micromanaged.  The company doesn't give feedback about performance unless it is negative.  The manager doesn't learn names of team members or care about individuals.  They also do not give proper safety equipment.  You will have pain from repetitive motion injuries but be discouraged from getting medical treatment or reporting it to safety.
Come to work. Do your work. Job secured! They are so laid back and chill that as long as you come to work and do your work you will basically keep your job. and the benefits are a plus!

It is an alright job for the area/what you do. The benefits are nice, especially since I had never worked a job with benefits before. The only reason why I'm leaving is because I have a degree and want to make more money.

It is a good place to work.
The primary focus on making prescription medications safer and more affordable for patients.
the culture is one of inclusion

I know with any job there's going to be good days and bad days, but it's been mostly bad days. It's not the management that make it bad, they're kind, courteous, and they're genuinely helpful. It's interacting with the patients that make it difficult, which is the norm with any customer service job, but they seem more horrible than any other job. Occasionally you'll get a few that make the job worthwhile. The system that's also used is very frustrating in the fact that it's outdated.

Provided good training and supervisors were helpful. Typically, each worker had a designated list of orders that needed to be completed. Completion included not only fulfilling the order, but also verifying prescriptions and insurance.

It's a moot point now, seeing as it was a Corporate decision to close our site, but I'm hopeful that Express Scripts will be bought out by a better-run Pharmacy Benefits Manager at some point. I enjoyed the people that I worked with at the Pueblo, CO location very much, but I was made aware pretty quickly that upper management didn't care about the average Patient Care Advocate.

Many promises, none kept for work from home. Worked over an hour to pay tolls. Highly stressful - phone job where you felt micromanaged and constantly on guard. I use language that reflects the person to whom I am speaking and was "pointed" for "okey dokey." Bad environment.

From my experience, ESI is full of opportunities of growth but the company is so large and monolithic that unless you are put into a position to work with a team doing conquering great challenges and open to change you will have to pay your "dues" and have to go through learning the inefficient ways the team does things as opposed to being able to bring a new viewpoint.
Express Scripts Inc, ESI is the largest Pharmacy Benefit Manager (PBM) in United States and you will be exposed to a lot of technologies and methods on a daily basis.

The management, believe it or not is not the problem. They are for the most part kind, courteous and will work with you in order to make sure that things are being met. It is the patients that are the problem and working with other departments. The patients feel entitled, are many times downright ungrateful and try and treat you as if they are beneath them. The system that is used there is horrible, along with many other deficiencies (I.E receiving constant calls about members being unlocked out of their online profiles) and many times employees from other departments are lazy and do not want to do any work . The one problem with management, no cell phones are allowed on the floor, HOWEVER they are on their phones.

As with any Fortune 500 company, this one was not without it's ups and downs.  Change of ownership made things a bit shaky in the latter part of my employment, but there are plenty of good people there to work with and a genuine culture that make things much better.

The job itself can be very fulfilling, but unfortunately the pay was is so low that it loses its appeal pretty quickly. Also they give very little incentive to go above and beyond for customers. Which leaves lack luster performance with some of the employees.
overall this is a friendly environment and great place to work for.  They encourage employee success and offer great benefits.  People are really friendly and easy to get along with.
The day was always busy and learning new things. The system enhancements were always needing to be tested and audited. The team was well rounded and close nit.

Fine to work there. Compensation is low but working environment is Ok. Workload is not very hard. 
Managers are willing to help. Working on your own pace.

Balancing , fast paced and friendly atmosphere. Put forth hard work and will be notice for the possibility of advancement. Management listen and provides feedback with concerns. The company promotes education advancement.

Anyone there is very nice when you are first starting and everyone is interested in making sure that you're able to complete your job successfully so yes I would recommend this job to anyone that starting out and also anyone that's looking for a good place to work

great place to work and very informational Ensure that each package receives the correct paperwork, meds, shipping labels, and addresses to our customers with 100% accuracy.
Data base analyzing to identify the correct quantity & productivity of medications
Safely ensured all 3 hazardous materials were bulked correctly.
Completing 6 orders in an hour

calling the dr office for clarifications or new rx's 
entering new prescriptions, calling patients for additional information
lax about dress code, not as professional as it should be

My position at my facility was treated very differently from the same position at other facilities, but the pay did not reflect this. Upper Management was in shambles, and was not very skilled at executing appropriate actions to properly manage facility. This is possibly due to secret knowledge that the facility was being shut down, leading to apathy about engaging and caring for employees. Questionable hiring decisions, and gutting of quality staff positions.

The best part of this job, was the staff-level employees. There were many great people who worked very hard and were genuinely fun to work with.
Express Scripts is a job that you are looking to do and not take as a serious career advancement. The call center was very dramatic and their management is very immature.

assisted with in bound customer service with major corporation benefit and medical prescription policies and procedures. Conversed with many doctors offices and human resource specialist about benefits from Ford Motor Company, Chrysler Motor Company, General Electric, Ingersol Rand.

Fast paced, not much downtime, if you do your job, everything will be fine. Two 15 minute breaks and 30 minute lunch for call center reps. Calls are monitored, feedback was consistent across all supervisors that I had.
I enjoyed working there but wanted to utilize more of the education I received at school for pharmacy technican work. Call center work and not hands on pharmacy work.
Express Scripts Inc, ESI is the largest Pharmacy Benefit Manager (PBM) in United States and you will be exposed to a lot of technologies and methods on a daily basis.

Young, inexperienced management or old ones that ignore and look the other way
Misleading
No administrative support
No OT - (50-60 is required to do the job)
No communication
Treated like a contractor/temp person
The benefits and plenty of overtime it has plenty of job openings for advancement if that's what you desire. Some of the management is nice but some are awful.

NOT a good company to work for. Changes happen all the time with little to NO notice. New clients come on all the time with new rules offering you lots of opportunities to mess things and getting in trouble. Managers are secretive and not open to discussing future changes until its instituted. A very unstable work environment that does not allow employees to get good at their jobs before changes take place.
my review of express scripts.  Express scripts was very overwhelming but i loved the people there. call volume was always very high but mangment did work with me on my flexablitiy

Work was not difficult. Never felt supported by the company. As you may know, Express Script purchased the company I worked for. For all the years before Express Script I felt part of a good company. Not so with Express Script.
I had a good time working here the employees where nice and fun to be around. love the fact that you got to work alone and at a fast pace. It also gives you the opportunity to grow in the company.

my most enjoyable part  of my job was the people that i worked with.
We built a great relationship with each other, we were a family. We did alot of things outside of work with each other.

A lot of stress and demands for the wrong amount of pay. The amount it costs to survive does not out way the amount of pay received. 

It has a lot of work before meeting the standards of what is a competent employer.
stand in one spot for 10+ hours feet hurt you couldn't lean on anything cause you are packaging prescription medication security always watching every move feet hurt badly
All of the entry-level jobs are pretty easy to learn and the workload is nothing insane.  They do encourage you to cross train and advance in your department.
It's a great place to work if you like high call volumes.It is a very clean environment and a peaceful place to work.i would recommend anyone to work there.

One of the largest PBMs with an onsite cafeteria and plenty of parking along with a work-out facility.  Also offers healthcare and insurance benefits for employee and family.  Has the typical call center environment and used to offer work from home opportunities.

Autonomy, educational, great benefits and compensation.  Loved time spent with patients and families. Workplace culture is relaxed.  Hardest part of job at times was commuting to some patients or coordinating patients' schedules.

No really hard but  stressful. You helped out other locations that needed it. But didn't get paid every time you learned something new. Plus the mistakes you had to fix from the other sites were very big at times which took time and sometimes you worked pasted your break and there were no corrections made to your adherence. Plus if there account was messed up and something else was still wrong with it. you were to blame. Like i can say one, was when i scheduled a Rx to the policy before the scheduled time to stop scheduling Rx. due to the Pharm tech not being to get to it in time i received a missed commitment and that messed up my bonus. I didnt like that also about the job. Also, going to school full time working there was not an option and you couldn't drop down to part time so its either no school or having to find another job, and that's what I did.

company started off to be fun place to work but as it got bigger it got more about money then their employees.  long hours and constant review and management of time.  was not allowed to get up and take breaks if it was not your break time.  at times treating employees as children due to the monitoring of the time and productivity.
nice fast environment great company to grow within great benefits always offering overtime great bonus friendly co workers and awesome team players to help with meeting the pharmacy goals
You never knew what your job title was from day to day because it was changed constantly without notice. Management was a joke! They played favorites and politics in the workplace was off the charts.

I worked as a consultant for Medco/ Express Scripts for about 8 years.  Everything was great before Medco was acquired by Express Scripts.  The clash of cultures made difficult to have a positive environment the last couple of years of my stay there.
its an okay job it just isn't a job for me, the hours are ok for some, the people are friendly, great morale, lots of things you can get involved in if you like doing things like that

I loved working at ESI, the management was engaging with a great open door policy, there were many areas to development and advance in. The environment during the tenure I was there has made a positive mark on myself even as I have gone on to other companies.

On a typical day at work there was always something going on, poor management, HR horrible never have a straight answer to any question such as benefits. Lack of pay many time incorrect wanting the employee to wait it out for the next 2wks. Unexceptionable. No Professionlism at all. Would not recommend anyone to work for this company
Express Scripts Inc, ESI is the largest Pharmacy Benefit Manager (PBM) in United States and you will be exposed to a lot of technologies and methods on a daily basis.
UBC treated me as if I were an employee of the company.  They brought me onboard,  provided a mentor for transition of my responsibilities to me.  Management was supportive.

Management harasses employees and they are paid very little and do not provide equal advancement only for those they have preference over. Very stressful environment and hours are not flexible since you are provided a specific schedule and cannot change until a shift bid. They force you to work overtime or days that are suppose to be days off to cover for others.

very to nice to have opportunity to work from home.  
decent pay, currently have six weeks of vacation after 7 years.
not sure if they are still hiring work at home representitives or not though
Express Scripts Inc, ESI is the largest Pharmacy Benefit Manager (PBM) in United States and you will be exposed to a lot of technologies and methods on a daily basis.

Thank you for the opportunity to share, but if I have nothing nice to say, I should refrain from commenting.  The company has been through many changes and they are seeing just the beginning of change,  Buckle up!

Express scripts would have overtime that you could pick up if you wanted to and you could work anything you wanted. Also it never had to worry about people being there that was not allowed we had to waer a key to get it and out.
Working day sometime is fun, I have been working in Express Scripts many years and have a lot of diversity friends. We shared our experiences and culture. It is a good place to work.

it was all over the place at times but with a little work it would be much easier
busy at time all times it gets crazy 
i like mostly being able to be around others an working together doing good deads has always been my highest spot in work
Two 15 minute breaks. Very busy. Rewards oriented. The most enjoyable part of the job was being rewarded for goals met. The great deal of recognition that was alway given when the job was done well.

most ineffective and dysfunctional place ever worked at. Prescriptions rejected continuously for illogical reasons. Pharmacist's had a stuck-up attitude, really didn't need a pharmacist. Co-worker's judgemental and plain lazy. Many overweight and depressed people working for company.

Management is horrible, they want more than what u can give. No loyalty to people who’ve worked there for years. CEO or higher ups position don’t care about employees...they only care about the stocks and investors!

I have learned Customer Service experience.  It is a good place to learn how to work in a call center.  The most difficult part is handle calls from irate patients.  A typical day is taking from 60 to 100 calls a day.

The ability to be a part of very influential projects that resulted in our customers ability to order on-line and pay on-line was a beneficial experience.  Organizing and streamlining the Collection Process to a Risk Based Collections motivated the team to work smarter and focus on accounts that truly needed our assistance and guidance to remain in good standing with the organization.  BY doing so, we enabled the customers to continue with ordering so they could care for their patents care timely.

A typical day at work would would be pretty much routine. There is nothing to learn from management. The workplace culture is mundane and there is nothing hard about the position I hold. The most enjoyable time of the day is when its time to go home.
Work life was quite hectic, learning alot out of this. The management was good and quite helpful. very challenging and work overload, Work culture has been good and very formal.

when you are first hired at express scripts,  they tell you all good things about the job.  once you are in the company all those good things do not happen..VERY STRESSFUL JOB.  NOT RECOMMENDED ALL PEOPLE

Great company to work for, Provides more than average benefits

  As a Prior Authorization representative the role would be to engage with medical doctor offices to assist in Prior Authorization for medication.

Workplace Culture: seems fine, people are typically friendly

Enjoyable part: Freedom of use of the phones while reviewing documentation for Prior authorization

Promotion is readily available as long as you are.

Went in as a temp pharmacy tech working on updating insurance plans, too many techs, not enough work...spent weeks doing NOTHING and wasn't allowed to take off for holidays despite doing nothing all day
low pay long hours lots of overtime but without overtime salary was not enough to meet the cost of living. I had to move on for better pay and less hours

they bought out Medco just to get Medcos technology, once they got it they let Medco peoples go. and they weren't nice. i have been through companies closing down sites and they have been professional about it. express scripts were not professional, did not care about us. they walked in said we are closing you and you need to leave the building now. you can come back tomorrow. most of us in shock couldn't believe it. 
other companies have never thrown us out like trash but expres scripts did.

Laid off from 2012 merger and hope the new management is better than it was. During the merge, there was poor HR policies, direction from management was never consistent between shifts and there were old SOP's that no one would update.
I enjoyed working for Express Scripts and would still be if a new exciting option had not fallen in my lap. I was very sad to leave and very excited to work from home.

Express Scripts continues to find different ways to balance between productivity, quality and clients/patients expectations.  Changes have been made to make the jobs more streamline process and also focus on technology to enhance different processes.

It was a busy and fun place to work. Learned about how a pharmacy is run. The management was supportive and always willing to teach/explain everything.

There were no hard part to the position.The enjoyable part were the perks, insentives it was the best company to work for.

I love my job but it is stressful and really wish I was paid more than $10.50 an hour. The customers are sometimes happy and sometimes they just blame you and yell and scream at you and there is nothing you can do about it.

run daily reports
reviewed quality control 
process refunds
respond to account management issues
respond to requests from various departments
returning funds to plan sponsors
manangement is very poor, advancement is rare, they give you days off them away whe that day comes, management is never araound when you need them for a call, very poorly ran
This is a good place to work! The supervisors are kind and are willing to help! I love the variety the job gives me! I enjoy helping patients with their questions and issues!

-Processing 75-100 orders per day by phone
-I learned about pharmacy benefits and how they relate to medical insurance
-The management was monotonous and robotic
-The company had good core values but did not allow their employees to utilize them. The front-line customer service employees had no authority to assist a customer in expediting orders or prescription processing. The only advancement opportunities were reserved for people of minority.
-The hardest part of the job was hearing the stories of patients and their families

It Was A Pharmacidical Warehouse , I Learned A Lot, Bulking & Prepping Medication, I Validated Meds To Shelves, Verified Meds Before Shipping Out To Our Patients, And Assisted The Pharmacist Daily....
Express Scripts Inc, ESI is the largest Pharmacy Benefit Manager (PBM) in United States and you will be exposed to a lot of technologies and methods on a daily basis.

Workplace culture and good management. Supper Friendly work there. Every time people concentrate on Table tennis.
People not taking much pressure on their work
Worked until work ran out. Some day were busy others not so busy. I hoped that there were better opportunities there but it wasn't. I have been there for years.
I worked there but was fired due to management falsely putting in my FMLA. I was a good worker.  Was not my choice to leave. Supervisor putting in time to make there number look good cost me my job
ESI is a great place to work.  I have the autonomy to do my job without micromanagement from the leads and/or supervisor.  There are many activities to keep the employees engaged.

I felt like a child in grade school.  No trust for employees that did their job well.  Instead of focussing on employees that did not do a good job, they punished all employees by making us do degrading things in order to increase accuracy.
Wonderful place to work overall had the best experience while working for the company.To bad they closed down/relocated would have followed them anywhere if I did not have other responsibilities.

I enjoyed working with Express Scripts I feel they have a lot of great benefits but there was no room for advancement. I had insurance, paid time off and free lunch during the holidays. They are also big on diversity.

none, wasn't there long enough.  The training was adequate and the trainer knowledgable. The typical day was predictable but that was good. The people were friendly and cafeteria was good as well. The

When I 1st started working for express Scripts it was like working with family, mgmt was great and environment was comfortable and we wanted to do well for mgmt, then mgmt changed, became hostile and kept micromanaging people.
This was a contract job. There was free parking, Nice cafeteria and the food was cheap. Nice work area. My boss was really nice  and gave me challenging assignments

They should tell the truth to potenial employees. They have you thinking your working one shift and soon as training is over your on a totally different shift then what was told to you. Secondly they need to weed out all the racist managers who work there.
Express Scripts Inc, ESI is the largest Pharmacy Benefit Manager (PBM) in United States and you will be exposed to a lot of technologies and methods on a daily basis.
Good first job or perfect for a phone person nice pay if enjoy talking on phone this job is for you. Many different attitudes to deal with. Like look at computer all day it's for you
The training was so awful and out of order. They did not have proper on the job training. And when you get out of training they do not want to continue to help with any issues you may have.
Exciting place to work. Looked forward to going to work EVERYDAY! Employees where great. Everyday work load was moderate but had great team to work with.

while i was there 11 years, very few supervisors would have your back.  One even stabbed me in the back and played people agent each other, however his was eventually removed from the company,he left behind damage. 

The Executives do not acknowledge you unless you are an executive, example CEO, he would walk right past you and never so much as a "hi", disturbing!

All you will get is angry calls all day long, and that is because they do not care about customer service or giving correct information. This means that members have to call multiple times and are usually getting a different answer every time or not getting the issue resolved at all .The company's main focus is getting the person off the phone as quickly as possible so that your stats remain low and your team can be number #1. You may as well be chained to your desk because you are not allowed to use the restroom or leave your desk unless it is your designated break or lunch time. We were told to train our bodies to hold it or have a Doctors note. No one is on the same page there and how you perform your job is based on who trains you and what they know.
Excellent company.  Flex time is available only to those who can reach quality goals or are supervisor pets.  You are coached on the same mistake multiple times, by different people.
This was one of the best companies I have every worked for, I really learned a lot and they will definitely make sure that you are ready and well prepared to answer their patient's calls

Fast Paced environment, must will willing to adapt to changes in the work place. Dealing with upset patients were the most challenging days. The main concern for the patients, being mail order pharmacy, were the late deliveries of the Patient's prescription.

You sit at your computer and desk and enter in script information.
I learned how to read a prescription.
Supervisors walk around all the time and stand behind you. Not pleasant watch as if we were children, constantly reviewed your work. Having your work reviewed is fine but not the constant review you have at Express Scripts-it was an uncomfortable environment.
The hardest part of the job was the atmosphere. Along with at times not being able to enter data as quickly as I needed to when they would change what type of prescriptions we would be entering. 
Sitting constantly in a large room where we were not allowed to talk or even communicate with other co-workers. 
Enjoyed that they had days in which there were theme days, pajama day in which you could wear pajamas.
Data entry all day every day. Process prescriptions, have to type fast if not you would have to meet with supervisor who will tell you to be faster with no  mistakes
Company has a huge turnover rate and at the time management was not good leaders for the department I worked in. That's pretty much all I have to say about that.
Pay is poor, raises are few and office culture is inflexible. Strict and inflexible reviews. Office politics are a heavy climate at Express Scripts!!!

This is a "go along to get along" organization. If you're a square peg, you'll get pounded into a round hole or you'll get isolated and informed in every necessary way that your crazy ideas are unwelcome.

Worked in call center in new facility. Became aware of complexities of pharmacy protocol and prescription plans.  Was trained on the Medicare team.  Hardest part of job was demand for short call time even though patients had many questions and or needed to speak with a pharmacist (usually remained on phone, listening to their discussion to assist patient after pharmacy consult.)

Most enjoyable part of the job was the challenge of learning about prescriptions and interacting with patients, local pharmacists and physicians.
Short time at this mail order pharmacy, fast-paced setting. You can learn alot and also advance to different areas in the pharmacy. Long hours but others may find it worth it.
it was it was ok when I first started when it got bad so many sup got jobs then found better jobs so it was hard on every body they don't care if u have to pick up your kids

The pharmacy used to be fun. Great people, low stress. New management is absolutely horrendous. Micromanaging every aspect of our lives, both work and personal. Taking credit for the work of others. Throwing anyone under the bus. Wanting to be the centre of attention. Finding fault in the most trivial issues. Wanting to do everything because we aren't competent enough to do it the right way. Bully manager. Good people quit, or get fired.
I learned a new system to train employees on. I traveled for a month at a time to train. Most enjoyable part is the fellow employees. I worked with a great team.

from the trainers to the managers everyone is very polite and helpful with making all feel apart of the team. Although it is a lot of information to retain they make it easy to learn and obtain. Its easy to succeed in the work place atmosphere they have set.

It is very stressful at least for me.  the past 5 years or more you came to work not knowing whether or not you would have a job the next day.  About 5 years ago, we had around 1500 employees at the facility where I work. now we have less then 500, maybe around 350.
time went by fast because you were always busy could have used more training on some systems you were not familiar with.  liked working with Tricare members to resolve concerns on billing issues.
The company essentially is a mail order and pbm combined in one and it was recently located to Missouri where they had built a state of the art facility
majority of an inbound call center however you get to learn new information as well and you secured you spot as long as your job is completed always giver your all in your position.

I was offered to be hired on full time but they were going to cut my current pay and I could not afford that pay cut. If was offered another position there with a better pay i would go back there to work.

They had alot of break rooms for you to enjoy. They also gave you discount on the gym that was there as well and discount on food in the food courts. They allow you to eat small meals at desk, they were understanding due to breaks and gave extra training when needed. they were very helpful at anytime.

Fun workplace good benefits flexible work hours very productive nice place to work good training I enjoy working with people and helping them solve their problems and concerns.A typical work day especially Mondays are very busy.  The work place culture is very diverse

I really liked working at Express Scripts. I learn a lot from my co-worker and supervisors. I had to quit because they had shift changes and I got to work in evenings which was not working out for me and my family.

The supervisors there were awesome.They always provided fun activities and made you feel like family.They always had extra training videos and activities for us to do to keep us up to date on any changes
Everything is good about this company, I joined working with my team. It has an excellent work life culture . My only suggestion is that management needs to allow one day without meetings.

Contact Center for inbound calls. Fast paced and patient oriented. I learned about Pharmacy Benefits for civilian members and members of the Department of Defense. It was very challenging to meet the patients needs while meeting the time constraints of the call. I enjoyed helping patients with all their concerns and needs.

Express Scripts is a great entry level job.  I am grateful to have been given the opportunity to become an Express Scripts team member.  I had no previous job experience and this job gave me 8 years of fantastic work ethics and experience. 
Plus, management would always call me by my name, which means a lot.
Did not get the opportunity to learn the corporate cultural environment rules.I did learn a little bit about how to interact with people.The management needs to be more patient and not so judgmental.
A typical day at Express Scripts I would take inbound calls from patients. The patients was normally calling to pay for a co pay or to get an assistant program to assist with medication coast.
Good place to work for with a fast paced environment and great place to get career building skills. Excellent support with company growth and wanting to achieve goals.
Fast paced, customer service, having emails and phone calls to members that used express spirits for the pharmacy benefit manager or mail order pharmacy

It may have improved since I was there; but don't intend ti put myself back in that situation.

Except that I had a cool manager (who got fed up and left) I never saw any respect for the people around me.

Nobody wants to help anyone else; constant back-stabbing. Throw your team "under the bus" and go on.

Express Scripts was very organized in structure. We all had a job to do daily, weekly, and monthly were responsible for meeting goals. We were given the tools to do so as well as help our team members to do so.

I learned how to create morale and offer support to those who needed it.

Management was top notch. They had it figured out as far as running a call center with a million different personalities working so closely together goes.

We had a family oriented workplace culture. Everyone was there to help you succeed while in competition at the same time...weird but true.

The hardest part of the job was losing someone who could not meet the goals after additional training, coaching, and counseling. 

The most enjoyable part of the job was the friendly competition amongst each other and of course, winning that competition!

Not applicable 
Dont really care to fill this out
it was a nice place to work. Its just like all other call centers. You work at one you worked for them all

A typical day at work was sign into your computer, turn on your phone, pull up orders and start making calls.  What I learned was how to pronounce the names of medications.  The hardest part of the job was talking to patients to tell them a particular medication was unavailable.  The most enjoyable was getting to know my fellow associates.

Express scripts was a great place to work. Compensation was very competitive and the benefits were very affordable. Hour lunch break, management was fairly good but very unorganized. There were what seem to be hourly changes

This was a temporary position. I wasn't there long enough to fully learn all that I would like to have learned. I felt I needed additional time there to understand all the ins and outs of their system.
Nice place to work, great co workers room for growth if you fit the criteria. Close to home, old ways seems to be a thing of the past in some instances still there in others.
They get a lot of things right and they get a lot of thing very wrong. Communication is extremely poor and only got worse over the years. Diversity is the best thing about the company.
Express Scripts Inc, ESI is the largest Pharmacy Benefit Manager (PBM) in United States and you will be exposed to a lot of technologies and methods on a daily basis.
Mail order pharmacy, called whenever had trouble at local pharmacy.  Research and explaining benefits to members or updating eligibility info as needed.
work hard,work fast,smile, happy, do what your told, personabilty,come to work on time,nice view, nice people, please dress according to the job, get well deservbe breaks
